SamPy.fitting.fitsÂ¶

Various functions which can be fitted to given data.

author:Sami-Matias Niemi
contact:sniemi@unc.edu
requires:NumPy
requires:SciPy
version:0.1

Functions

FindZeroDoubleExp(p, x0[, yshift]) Finds the zero point of a negative double exponential function.
FindZeroSingleExp(p, x0[, yshift]) Finds the zero point of a negative exponential function.
FitDoubleExponent(xcorr, ycorr, initials) Fits a negative double exponential to data.
FitExponent(xdata, ydata, initials) Fits a negative exponential to x and y data with an initial guess given by initials.
Gaussian(ydata[, xdata, initials]) Fits a single Gaussian to a given data.
Gaussian2D(data) Fits a 2D Gaussian to a given data.
PolyFit(x, y[, order]) Fits a polynomial to the data.
doubleExponent(x, p, shift)
param x:data
linearregression(x, y[, confidence_level, ...]) A function to calculate simple linear regression
polynomial5(x, p0, p1, p2, p3, p4) 5th order polynomial
singleExponent(x, p, shift)
param x:data
